definition.name: Input
definition.description: A reusable input component that extends the native HTML input element with consistent styling and behavior. It supports all standard HTML input attributes and includes custom styling with a focus state, disabled state, and file input styling. The component is built with accessibility in mind and includes proper transitions and visual feedback for different states.

properties.description: Accepts all standard HTML input properties through React.ComponentProps<'input'>

className.description: Additional CSS classes to be applied to the input element. These will be merged with the default classes using the cn utility.

type.description: The type of the input (e.g., 'text', 'password', 'email', etc.)

interactions: Users can type or paste text into the input
The input shows a focus ring when focused using keyboard navigation
File inputs have special styling for the file selection button
Disabled state shows reduced opacity and a not-allowed cursor
definition.visualLayout: A single input field with consistent padding, border, and focus states. The input has a height of 9 units (h-9), full width, rounded corners, and a transparent background. It includes specific styling for file inputs and disabled states.
definition.implementationNotes: The component uses React.forwardRef to properly handle ref forwarding, which is important for form libraries and accessibility. It uses the cn utility for class name merging to allow custom styling while maintaining default styles.
